title: CTRL0000036622 - Transcribed Interview of Kimberly Fletcher, (January 14, 2022)

data.text: SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE
JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES,
WASHINGTON, D.C.
DEPOSITION OF:
KIMBERLY FLETCHER
Friday, January 14, 2022
Washington, D.C.
The deposition in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 10:04
a.m.
Present:
Representative Kinzinger.
Appearances:
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
INVESTIGATIVE COUNSEL
SENIOR INVESTIGATIVE COUNSEL
RESEARCHER
STAFF ASSOCIATE
CHIEF CLERK
For THE WITNESS:
VINCENT A. CITRO, ESQ.
CINDY LEADHOLM, PARALEGAL
HORWITZ & CITRO, P.A.
17 E. Pine Street
Orlando, FL 32801
It is 10:04 a.m. on January 14, 2022.
We are here for the
deposition of Kimberly Fletcher conducted by the House Select Committee to Investigate
the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to House Resolution 503.
This deposition is being taken remotely via Webex.
This will be a staff-led
deposition.
don't see that any members are present, but they may join at some point.

I will ask, if I miss someone, please feel free to prompt me if and when any

deposition if we had a camcorder going on the side during the transcription being taken.

Very similar, as Vince would understand, to in a civil

So it's important that you respond to each question with an audible, verbal

sorted out.
Hopefully, we won't run into those issues today.
Ms. Fletcher, as far as substance goes, we'd ask that you give complete answers to
the best of your recollection.
If a question is unclear, please just ask for clarification.
you don't know the answer, you can just say so.
You may refuse to answer a question only to preserve a privilege that is
recognized by the select committee.
If you refuse to answer a question based on a

objection.
question.

Finally, I'll remind you, as we remind all witnesses, that it's unlawful to

As far as logistics go for the deposition today, we're happy to take breaks as you

that.

one-page cover letter.
regulations that were appended to exhibit 1.

production of documents under exhibit 1 was December 23, 2021.
that?

to decline to produce each and every document that would be called for by the

2021, making clear that you would decline to produce anything at that time but that you
would nonetheless appear for the deposition with the intent to invoke your constitutional
rights in response to questions as may be appropriate.
Ms. Fletcher, I'm just putting all of that out there at the front end to say that we
understand your attorney has made those objections on your behalf.
to ask questions that are relevant to the select committee's investigation with the hope
that you will answer.
Our goal today is
If you have an objection or a privilege assertion, you can assert that for the record.
I will try to clarify the basis for your objections.
And I understand from your counsel that you may intend to assert the Fifth
Amendment to many of the questions that I may ask.
out for the record that your counsel or you have not received or reviewed the questions
that I intend to ask, and, therefore, it would seem unlikely for you or him to know in

of my questions.
Be that as it may, I would point
Even so, where there are objections, our goal is simply to understand the basis for
those objections and to fairly evaluate it.
And, ultimately, the more detail that you can
provide about the basis for the objection, the easier it will be for the select committee to
consider that objection.
Now, because the Fifth Amendment has been raised by your counsel in the letters
to the committee, we will say that it has been almost a year, or more than a year at this
point, since the events of January 6, 2021.
that have been filed against hundreds of defendants for actions that they took that day.
But in all the information available to the select committee and in the media coverage of
those events, we have not identified any suggestion, Ms. Fletcher, that you are the

There have been numerous criminal charges
So I'll just ask you on the front end, do you understand that the Fifth Amendment

A
Yes.
Q
In other words --
Mr. Citro.
before you continue, our paralegal has called in on the

number.

I'll just say that all we want is the truth.
And I want to make sure that you

understand that?

Yes.

So I just want to put that out there to say that I'm aware there are different

So I'll just rephrase the question.
A
Okay.

Is that correct?
Constitution, including the First, Fourth, and Fifth Amendments.

the First Amendment shield you from having to comply with the subpoena issued by the

Q

I can definitely help with several of those.
On it."

I decline to answer pursuant to the rights afforded to me under the

known Mr. Alexander?

questions that we would ask about your knowledge of events that were held in

record that areas 8, 9, 10, and 11 are contiguous on the east front of the Capitol.

out who was who."'
